intro: Stenostephanus suburceolatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf stephanus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pale pink, are attractively arranged in whorls along the stems. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
